newsitem.title: USA: PHP Healthcare to divest unit, sees Q3 loss.
newsitem.headline: PHP Healthcare to divest unit, sees Q3 loss.

text.p: PHP Healthcare Corp said late Tuesday it will report a third quarter loss resulting from charges that include the divestment of the long-term care business within its Government Managed Care Division.

The company also said it is discontinuing its facilities development and maintenance division, Sterling Communities Cooperation, and extending a retirement package to outgoing chairman Charles Robbins.

These moves would result in a $5 million charge in the third quarter, the company said, on top of a $10 million charge for its Chartered Health Plan business to write off receivables for certain claims.
Wall Street had been expecting the company to report a third quarter profit of $0.22 per share in the third quarter, according to First Call consensus estimates.
PHP said it would report third quarter results for the period ended January 31 no later than March 17.
